title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 45-6.8 - Access and egress
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 45-6.8 - Access and egress

State Regulations

In addition to sections
45-2.11, 45-2.12, and
45-2.13
of this Part go-kart
operations shall be surrounded by a fence or other suitable barricade designed
to control non-patron access to the facility and to each go-kart track. (a) Access points shall be clearly
marked. (b) Gates or other suitable
controls shall be provided at the entrance and exit. (c) For go-kart tracks built, or fencing
installed, after the effective date of this regulation, fences or barricades
shall: (1)
be at least 42 inches
high; (2)
have no opening that will
pass a four inch ball; and
(3)
be
provided with self closing, self-latching, full height, gates at all entrance
and exit points. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
45-6.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
